alert.note: Alert for Lipscomb; Ochiltree (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 1:57PM CDT until June 04 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Texas... Wolf Creek at Lipscomb affecting Ochiltree and Lipscomb Counties. For the Wolf Creek...including Lipscomb...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Wolf Creek at Lipscomb. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Water is over the lowest banks. Cattle in the floodplain may be threatened. The creek is over 800 feet wide at the bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 6.5 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM CDT.
